My Work

If you'd like to have a look at some code, look me up on Github or Codepen.

But otherwise, here's a portfolio of work I've done so far.

  • All
  • Web
  • Mobile
  • Emailers
  • Graphic Design
Click on the image previews to see the full image

  • Twickets site / Twickets mobile web app

    Working with 2 other developers (1 back end developer, 1 iOS developer), I was involved with the development of both an iPhone app and a mobile web app for Twickets - a "peer-to-peer" service that started on Twitter listing tweets of spare tickets for music gigs, football matches, etc. that are being sold at face value or less

    • HTML5 mobile web app developed using jQuery Mobile framework, responsive web design and a mobile first approach
    • created UI graphics for iPhone app (ranked #50 in iTunes App Store's Top Free Apps chart, #7 in Entertainment Top Free App chart 1 week into release)
    Client:
    Twickets
    Follow @twickets
    * Work done at Vexed Digital (now known as Future Platforms)

  • www.dominos.co.uk / www.dominos.ie / www.dominos.de

    I was involved in a number of sprints throughout 2011-2012 implementing various front end design updates and new features added across all three sites, such as

    • user interface for My Domino's (registered users area, including related functionality throughout each site)
    • built layout for Store Locator page in Domino's Germany site
    • Domino's Movies front end
    Client:
    Domino's Pizza UK, Ireland and Germany
    * Work done at Vexed Digital (now known as Future Platforms)

    www.devere.co.uk / www.deverevenues.co.uk / www.devere-hotels.co.uk

    booking.deverevenues.co.uk

    Design update for brand relaunch in 2011.

    Working in a team with 2 other front end developers, work done included

    • booking panel interface and My De Vere registered user area on De Vere Hotels, Venues and Luxury Lodges sites
    • front end for De Vere Venues
    • layout templates and brand specific styling for De Vere Group, Hotels, Venues sites' respective online booking engine
    • brand specific HTML email templates for booking confirmation emails
    Client:
    De Vere Group
    * Work done at Vexed Digital (now known as Future Platforms)

  • The first part of my submitted 3-part Web Technologies unit assignments.

    The challenge was to design a visually attractive multi-page website using strictly W3C standards compliant XHTML1.0 and CSS2.1. As little graphics as possible was to be used as graphics work would not be assessed at this point.

    Using CSS, I set up the framework to allow for a transitioning background effect. As the user scrolls down the page, the background image changes from black circles to grey circles. This would later be built upon in the next assignment to transition from one image to a completely different one.

    A timeline was also made for the website's Band of the Month page and this was done purely with CSS2.1 styling. Being a fluid site layout, the timeline bars' widths are fully fluid. You can see it in action on the demo website

    Client:
    Personal (Web Technologies unit Assignment 1)
    Tools:
    Notepad++, Photoshop (for website design mockup only)

  • The second part of my submitted 3-part Web Technologies unit assignments.

    With the website's styling all done, my plan was now to incorporate images into the website design. Images were created using a variety of tools ranging from GIMP for image manipulation and creation to Inkscape for vector images. Assessment also included use of JavaScript and libraries like jQuery to provide some "animation" effects.

    JavaScript was used to implement a style changer (conceptually similar to Last.fm's for users when logged in). A image/photo slider in the Media section was also implemented using jQuery. The user can choose to skip to another photo in the queue by clicking on the number list.

    Feel free to play around with the fully working demo website

    Client:
    Personal (Web Technologies unit Assignment 2)
    Tools:
    GIMP, Inkscape, Notepad++

  • Incorporated into the website for the second part of my submitted 3-part Web Technologies unit assignments as a mock "gig poster".

    Work done used a combination of GIMP and Inkscape to achieve the desired effect for the 4 central images in the poster.

    Client:
    Personal (part of Web Technologies unit Assignment 2)
    Tools:
    GIMP, Inkscape

  • Emailer promoting a contest run in December 2010. I was given the band's publicity shot and "proof of purchase form" image to work with to create a fresh central image. I also did the tables-based HTML coding for the emailer.

    Client:
    Universal Music Malaysia
    Tools:
    Notepad++, Photoshop

  • The company already had a standard online contest form prepared, but needed a banner showcasing the prizes (imported band merchandise).

    Client:
    Universal Music Malaysia
    Tools:
    Photoshop

  • Banner image showcasing albums available in a promotion featured in Universal Music Malaysia's January 2011 newsletter.

    Client:
    Universal Music Malaysia
    Tools:
    Photoshop

  • Name tag design for a Coldplay fan forum London boat trip meet-up / 'Christmas Lights' music video shoot. Inspired by the band's Viva La Vida world tour theme and the pink/blue colour theme on their official website as of November 2010.

    Client:
    Personal
    Tools:
    Photoshop

Who Am I?

I'm Kimmi Gan. A Front End Developer by trade. This is my personal web site, blog and digital playground for all things web techy.
